Question Text: Satsvarūpa:The classes are at 7. We have some fliers to hand out to you. [break] Swami's there Monday, Wednesday, [break] ...next Monday. So this is a real class with real progress. We're studyingBhagavad-gītāAs It Is.[break] I'm going to go around with a tambourine upside down for a collection. That will help us to keep this program going nicely in this area. Also, very important, the Swami will leave this area as soon as another city gives him something more attractive. Attractive means to preachKṛṣṇaconsciousness. [break]
Answer Text: That you have to test. Now I have given you this one formula. By following anyguruor any principle, if you actually develop your love of God, then it is nice. Otherwise it is useless waste of time. That is the test. But they, so far I know, these yogis, they are themselves God. They say that everyone is God. And who is dog? So I think it is not very congenial. How everyone can be God? Then what is the meaning of God?

Question Text: Guest (1):(inaudible)
Answer Text: If everyone is God then what is the meaning of God? You must give definition of God. If you do not, then you do not know what is God. Therefore you are asking...

Question Text: Guest (1):(inaudible)
Answer Text: So it is a great science. It is not bogus propaganda. And based onBhagavad-gītāand Vedic literatures. Not that it is imaginary. No. There is...(inaudible), realized persons. There is chance of...(inaudible). So if you are here now, take advantage of this great science. And we are prepared to submit... (many people talking)

Question Text: Guest (2) (Indian man):I want to love everyone.
Answer Text: Then you... That is bogus. You cannot love everybody. If you love God, then you can love everybody. Because God is everything. So just like if you pour water on the root...

Question Text: Guest (2):If God is everything, then why don't you, not loving one by one? Why...?
Answer Text: Yes. But you... That is... Just like if you love one tree, then you have to pour water on the root. Not that every leaf. If you want to maintain your body, then you have to supply foodstuff in the stomach. Not to your eyes. Not to your ear. When you get a nice cake, you don't put it here. You put it here. Why? That is the process. There are nine holes in your body. Why do you put in this hole?

Question Text: Guest (2):Yes, but...
Answer Text: First of all answer this.

Question Text: Guest (2):Well, I agree with you, but...
Answer Text: You have to follow the real process; then you'll get it. That is love.(?)

Question Text: Guest (2):You have to go to the root but in the meantime we don't ignore everything else. I mean...
Answer Text: If you ignore the root and you take the leaf you simply spoil your time.

Question Text: Guest (2):No, but what I wanted to say is that why can't love of the God and love of matter go and rise up to...?
Answer Text: Yes, if you love God, you love matter and God...

Question Text: Guest (2):Then you said that the technique, that you decide as to whether you are succeeding is, you'll find out whether a technique is the best or not when your love for God will increase and love for matter will decrease.
Answer Text: No. In relationship with God... What is matter? Matter is another manifestation of God's energy. Just like if you love yourself, your body, then naturally you love your finger, the part of the body. Therefore God is the supreme whole. If you love God, then you can understand that I have to love everybody.

Question Text: Guest (3) (Indian man):What is God?
Answer Text: What is God? God... Can you define God?

Question Text: Guest (3):Is God supposed to be energy or is God supposed to be...
Answer Text: Energy is God's energy. Just like sun and sunshine. Sunshine is the energy of sun. Just try to understand. The energy, sunshine, and the sun is not different. But still if you are satisfied with the energy sunshine, it is not sun. Try to understand this philosophy.

Question Text: Guest (3):Are you saying that energy is God? God is energy?
Answer Text: Energy, being nondifferent from God, in one sense, it is God, but energy is not God at the same time. The same example. Just like sun and the sunshine. Sunshine is the energy of the sun, but sunshine, if it enters in your room, if you think that "Sun has entered into my room," that is wrong. But sunshine is not different from the sun. Similarly... That is explained in theBhagavad-gītā,mayātatamidaṁsarvaṁjagatavyakta-mūrtinā,mat-sthāni...[Bg.9.4]. [break] "Everything is resting in Me." That means in His energy. But not that everything is God.

Question Text: Guest (3):It would appear that to claim that you can reach eternal bliss or I don't know what else you might call it, by just chanting, it seems to be too easy.
Answer Text: That is one process of self-realization. There are different process of self-realization. For this age, when people are less intelligent, this process is right.

Question Text: Guest (2):...what you are doing by chanting is kind of...
Answer Text: You chant and you will understand. If you have no child, then how can you understand what is the labor of producing a child?

Question Text: Guest (3):But then it is like saying that if you haven't ever leaped into a well, you don't know what will happen to you if you leap into a well.
Answer Text: First of all you do not know yourself. The first ignorance is that you are identifying yourself with this body, which you are not. First of all try to understand yourself, then you will understand what is God. You do not know yourself.

Question Text: Guest (3):But I am God, right? I am God. You are God too.
Answer Text: You are dog.

Question Text: Guest (3):But you are me and I am you. We are both God. Right?
Answer Text: No, no.

Question Text: Guest (3):Why not?
Answer Text: You are not God because God... You do not know what is the meaning of God. What do you mean by God? First of all define.

Question Text: Guest (3):Everything is God.
Answer Text: If you apply that definition, then you are God. First of all define what is God.

Question Text: Guest (3):God is everything. God is it.
Answer Text: That is not the definition. God is not everything.

Question Text: Guest (3):And it is God. It is all it.
Answer Text: I say everything is God's energy. Everything is not God.

Question Text: Guest (3):Everything is not God?
Answer Text: Yes. Just like the same example I gave immediately that the sunshine and the sun. Sunshine is not different from the sun.

Question Text: Guest (2):How can the sun itself be different from it's energy? Sunshine is energy, sun is energy, and both of them...
Answer Text: No. This is an example. Sunshine is also energy. Everything material is an energy of the Lord. That's all right. But I'm giving you the example that sunshine and the sun is one, but at the same time different, simultaneously. You cannot accept sunshine as the sun. Suppose you are in the sunshine, you cannot say that you are in the sun planet.

Question Text: Guest (3):But it's all the same.
Answer Text: No. Why all the same? Why all the same?

Question Text: Guest (3):Of course. It's all the same. Sure.
Answer Text: If you go to the sun, you... You cannot go. You have no imagination what is sun, although you see it. How can I say that sunshine and sun is all the same?

Question Text: Guest (3):No. You don't have to have imagination. You have to have insight. That's... That's...
Answer Text: What is that insight? Do you think that sunshine and sun, they can be, is one?

Question Text: Guest (3):Everything is the same.
Answer Text: No, you cannot say that, that the temperature of the sun and the temperature of the sunshine is the same.

Question Text: Guest (2):No. But just because you have two different kinds of energies, why do you have to differentiate them? Essentially what he was trying to say...
Answer Text: That is intelligence. That is intelligence. One energy is acting as cooling, and the same energy is acting as heating. Why do you say it is heat and it is cool?

Question Text: Guest (3):It's all the same thing. Heat and cool is the same thing.
Answer Text: Why do you say the same thing? It is not the same thing.

Question Text: Guest (3):Everything is "it." It's all it.
Answer Text: No. That is nonsense. Cold is cold, heat is heat. Only it is acting. You are talking on the material platform. You are not spiritual. You don't talk nonsense. (laughter) No. We have got enough time.

Question Text: Guest (3):I'm not trying to argue with you. I'm just trying to understand, because from what I understand of it there is no difference between...
Answer Text: Just try to understand...

Question Text: Guest (3):No wait. Wait. Just one moment. Cause and effect are all the same thing.
Answer Text: No, no, no, no.

Question Text: Devotee:What do you mean they're the same thing?
Answer Text: This is cotton. The cause is cotton. Will you like to take cotton instead of the shirt?

Question Text: Guest (3):This is illusion.
Answer Text: Not illusion.

Question Text: Guest (3):Sure.
Answer Text: What do you mean by illusion? Don't talk nonsense. (laughter) If I gave you lump of cotton instead of this shirt, will you accept it?

Question Text: Guest (3):I'm sorry. I don't mean to argue. I am sorry.
Answer Text: You are arguing?

Question Text: Guest (3):I don't mean to argue with you.
Answer Text: No. If I say...

Question Text: Guest (3):I'm trying to understand something, but you...
Answer Text: This is cotton. This is cotton. Everyone knows. But if I give you a lump...

Question Text: Guest (3):Do you know that? Do you know that for a fact? How do you know this is not illusion? How do you know that? Do we know anything for sure?
Answer Text: What proof is that is illusion?

Question Text: Guest (3):No, no. Wait. The burden of the proof lies on you because I don't claim it is cotton. You claim it is cotton. So...
Answer Text: How do you say it is not cotton. First of all prove it.

Question Text: Guest (3):Initially...
Answer Text: No! First of all prove it that it is not cotton.

Question Text: Guest (3):No, no. One moment. You claim that it is cotton, therefore the burden of the proof lies on you inasmuch as you have to prove...
Answer Text: Everyone will say it is cotton. Everyone will say it is cotton. That is proof. Everyone will accept this is cotton, made of cotton. Who will say this is not made of cotton? But if I give you a lump of cotton instead of shirt will you accept it?

Question Text: Guest (3):I apologize. I don't mean to argue with you. I'm just trying to...
Answer Text: No, why not?

Question Text: Guest (1):You speak of God and matter and as matter being the thing which keeps us from seeing God. It seems to me it's something like pride and delusions, myself, and something like this, and ideas that I have.
Answer Text: You may have ideas, but I don't agree with your idea. If... I say that anything take it material or spiritual they are different energy of God. Matter is not different from God as it is energy of God, but still matter is not God.

Question Text: Guest (1):Yes.
Answer Text: Just try to understand this point, that whatever we see, that is distribution of energy of God. But energy and the energetic is not the same. But they are same as...simultaneously same also because you cannot separate. Just like fire and heat. You cannot separate heat from fire but heat is not fire. Just try to understand this. Heat is not fire although heat and fire cannot be separated.

Question Text: Guest (1):But I don't think I'm thinking of myself as matter but I'm also not thinking of myself as...
Answer Text: No. You are not matter. You are spirit. Your body is matter. You are also one of the energies. You are spiritual energy and your body is material energy. And because you are spiritual energy, therefore your intimate relationship with the spirit soul or the Supreme Soul... That isKṛṣṇaconsciousness or God consciousness. The body will change, but you, as spirit soul, you will not change. You are eternal.Nahanyatehanyamāneśarīre[Bg.2.20]. Body being changed, that is not changed. That is eternal. So we have to pick up our eternal relationship with God. That is missing.

Question Text: Guest (1):I'd like to know how physical things that are done, as chanting or dancing or... Are there no...? If you consider , as having any importance. How do these physical things affect our spiritual understanding?
Answer Text: Physical... Just like a milk preparation. You take large quantity of milk, you get diarrhea. But the same milk, if it is prepared into yogurt, if you take it, your diarrhea will be cured. So physical things, when treated spiritually, it cures physical disease.

Question Text: Guest (4) (Indian man):You said the approach to spiritual goal, through this way,HareKṛṣṇaHareRāma. Okay. Now there is another philosophy which has been preached by Ramakrishna and Vivekananda: "The service of man is the service of God."
Answer Text: And why not service of God service of man?

Question Text: Guest (4):No...
Answer Text: First of all answer this. If service of man is service of God, why not service of God, service of man?

Question Text: Guest (4):Okay. It is one and the same thing because within man is within the soul, which is...
Answer Text: So, one thing, suppose that service of God is service of man, then why should you go door to door serving ... If God is service of man, if you say service of man is service of God, then service of God is service of man.

Question Text: Guest (4):Okay. Fine.
Answer Text: That's all. Now if by serving God I can serve whole humanity...

Question Text: Guest (4):That's good.
Answer Text: That's good. But you, how many human beings you can serve? So my process is better.

Question Text: Guest (4):But I don't know what is God, but I know man within which God is present, a part of God is present.
Answer Text: That's all right. That's all right. That means we are, I mean to say for argument's sake. If God is everything...

Question Text: Guest (4):We are the parts of God.
Answer Text: That's all right. Now parts of God, just like your finger is part of your body. Suppose if you wash your finger, does it mean you are taking bath whole body?

Question Text: Guest (4):No, no, no, no. No.
Answer Text: Then how we can serve the whole by serving the part?

Question Text: Guest (4):Well, because it is a problem today, and right now, we country...
Answer Text: Your argument is that service of man is service of God. That is your point. I say that if service of man is service of God, then service of God is service of man. First of all you yes or no, you say it.

Question Text: Guest (4):It is one and the same but because I don't know God...
Answer Text: Then we serve God. You serve men. That's all.

Question Text: Guest (4):I don't know God. That's why... Which is present and which is a philosophy. That's why...
Answer Text: Now, philosophy,... Your argument is service of man is service of God.

Question Text: Guest (4):It is not my argument. It is argument of Ramakrishna and Vivekananda.
Answer Text: Now you are representing Ramakrishna. You are representing Ramakrishna. That's all. I take it.

Question Text: Guest (4):Because I am also in doubt about... I want to know the truth.
Answer Text: The truth is... The example I have given you, that service of the body means service of the stomach. Service of the body does not mean service of the finger.

Question Text: Guest (4):Service of the body means the service of part of God because body is an embodiment of the...
Answer Text: Now, I'll give you the example. Suppose if you want to... Take the whole body. If you want to serve this body you must give food. So where to give the food? To the finger or to the stomach? Therefore God is the stomach. Supply food there and every part of the body will be full.

Question Text: Guest (4):Okay good. Stomach is the part of God. I don't say he's the whole of God. Part of God. Because... (several people are talking)
Answer Text: All right. Car is waiting.

Question Text: Guest (4):Okay. Next time I go to Harvard I'll just get...
Answer Text: Thank you. I thank you for your questions.

Question Text: Guest (4):Oh, okay, fine. I'll ask you again. (end)
Answer Text: ...form a committee from education in your...

Question Text: They have to be taught reading, and for this they have primers.
Answer Text: Primary readings.

Question Text: And this is all right to use?
Answer Text: Because we haven't got any books yet.

Question Text: What about taking the primers and changing the names of the people to people likeSatyabhāmāand give them spiritual names. Would that be nice?
Answer Text: Yes.

Question Text: Hari-nāmāmṛtam.
Answer Text: Yes.

Question Text: All right. Arithmetic should be taught?
Answer Text: Arithmetic? Yes. That is necessary.

Question Text: What about any history? World history or American history or American literature or English literature?
Answer Text: American history. That's all. They are Americans. They should learn American history. Don't bother much.

Question Text: Any Indian history?
Answer Text: Indian history, that...Bhāgavatais all right.

Question Text: Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam?
Answer Text: ThatKurukṣetrabattle. That's all. And there are many other stories in theBhāgavatam.They are all historical.

Question Text: What about literatures? When they get older, of course. This would be for when they are older.
Answer Text: Literature, we have got so many.Bhagavad-gītā, Śrīmad-Bhāgavata.

Question Text: Any English literature, American literature, English literature?
Answer Text: Yes. Any... Some of the English literature, recognized.

Question Text: Any of the sciences at all?
Answer Text: I don't think we require any science. What do you think?

Question Text: Geology, zoology, astronomy.
Answer Text: Biology, you can teach them the evolution of the species fromPadma-Purāṇa,8,400,000's, one after another. Yes.

Question Text: What about astronomy? Anything like that? No. Okay. Any animal husbandry they can learn out there. Animal husbandry they will learn...
Answer Text: That they will learn practically, cow keeping.

Question Text: At what age should they be taught to cookprasādam?
Answer Text: Yes.

Question Text: At what age should they be taught to cook?
Answer Text: After twelve years.

Question Text: After twelve. And you think they can be taught typing, for instance? A skill like typing and how to use typewriter?
Answer Text: Does it require all? Well, just this knowledge is required.

Question Text: And the only other... Oh, how old should they be before Deity worship, they do Deity worship?
Answer Text: Just after ten years.

Question Text: After ten years? Then they can do Deity worship?
Answer Text: Yes.

Question Text: That'sRādhā-KṛṣṇaDeity worship.
Answer Text: Any Deity. Or worshipRādhā-Kṛṣṇa.

Question Text: He said after ten.
Answer Text: No, they are keeping as plaything now, not they are regularly worshiping.

Question Text: Kīrtanānanda:He means in the temple they can officiate, doāratiand things...
Answer Text: Yes.

Question Text: And you suggested... I have it written down somewhere. You suggested a certain number of hours for their school, about five hours or four hours a day.
Answer Text: Three hours in the morning, two hours in the evening. That's all. Not at a stretch. Morning, evening. And in the noon they should take theirprasādam,take little rest.

Question Text: Because our literatures are a little difficult to read...
Answer Text: Yes. You have to make some suitable literature.

Question Text: Something... When they can do that, then they can readBhagavad-gītā.They try a little, but it's very difficult to begin.
Answer Text: No.

Question Text: They cannot begin.
Answer Text: Yes. (end) ThisKṛṣṇaconsciousness movement is composed of four different stages. The first stage is to understand the relationship with Godhead, orKṛṣṇa. Because the conditioned souls at the present moment, they have forgotten self. They have forgotten their relationship withKṛṣṇa. Actually the relationship is there, eternal, but under the influence ofmāyāhe is thinking that "I am something of this material world," identifying himself with this body. So we have to awake them from that illusory existence, what he is not. The whole mistake of the modern status of life... I don't say modern civilization. This is coming up since the creation of this material world. Sometimes it is in greater degree and sometimes in lesser degree. InSatya-yugathe same condition, but in lesser degree. But inKali-yugathe condition is in greater degree. So the first business is to awake the conditioned souls from their illusory position, that he is thinking, "I am this body and anything in relationship with this body is very important."Janasyamoho 'yamahaṁmameti[SB5.5.8].This is illusion. We speak of illusion,māyā.This is illusion, that "I am this body and anything in relation of this body..." I have got special relationship with certain woman, so I think, "She is my wife. I cannot do without her." Or another woman from whom I have taken birth, "She is my mother." Similarly father, similarly sons. In this way, country, society, at the most, humanity. That's all. But all these things are illusion because they are in bodily relationship.Yasyātmā-buddhiḥkunapetri-dhātukesaevago-kharaḥ[SB10.84.13].Those who are passing on on this illusory condition of life, they are compared with the cows and the asses. So our first business is to wake up the general mass of people from this illusory condition of life. SoBack to Godheadis specially meant for that purpose. We are pushing ourBack to Godheadto the general mass of people to the first condition, first status of enlightenment. And then those who are becoming enlightened, coming forward, "Swamiji, or the society, please make me a member. Please initiate me," he is coming forward, understanding his position. So that is second stage, to train him how to awaken his, that dormant love of God. That is another stage, training.Sambandhaabhidheya.Then, when he is actually in love of Godhead, then he can understand the higher status of loving exchange betweenRādhāandKṛṣṇaand theVṛndāvana. This is third, third stage, yes. And the fourth stage isparamahaṁsastage, who is always enjoying.Santaḥsadaivahṛdayeṣuvilokayanti. Premāñjana-cchurita-bhakti...When one is completely merged in the ocean of love of Godhead, he will relish in any condition of lifeKṛṣṇa, present.Kṛṣṇapresent means,Kṛṣṇapresent, His name present, His form present, Hislīlāpresent, His paraphernalia present. Everything.Kṛṣṇais not alone. We are not impersonalist. As soon as we say, "Kṛṣṇa,"Kṛṣṇameans with His name, fame, opulence, entourage, pastime, etc. SoBack to Godheadgenerally deals in two stages of understanding, the, to awaken the relationship and to train them. Although our aim is... That is our aim, to come to the highest platform of loving exchange, but generally, we are dealing with the mass of people. Therefore our propaganda should be how to, by reasoning, by philosophy, by science, by argument, how to convince him that he is in illusory stage. These politicians, these scientists, these philosophers, they have no advanced knowledge except the human being. That's all. Their ultimate goal is that if they can do something, humanitarian work, welfare work to the... The Vivekananda, or the Aurobindo, or this, what is called, the Russell, or Romain Roland, and so many, they are coming. And the yogis, they are trying to be self-satisfied by meditation. But nobody is concerned with God, orKṛṣṇa. Nobody is concerned. This is the position of the world. So under the circumstances, our first business is how to awaken people from this illusory condition, that he is thinking, "I am this body," or the most well-being is taking care of this body or bodily relationships. So we have to take out from that illusory condition. So that should be the policy of ourBack to Godhead.And the, so far the editors are concerned, they are supposed to know all these conclusions. Now we have got two editors,Hayagrīvaand Satsvarūpa. I believe both of you know the conclusion which I am trying to push on within this movement. So you should work cooperatively in such a way that you don't deviate from the policy, and conjointly, consulting together, so that I may be relieved from petty minor things. But if there is some difficulty, I am at your service. Now what is the difficulty at the present moment? [break]

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:I have a different list.
Answer Text: And so far the articleHayagrīvawritten, it is very nice. It should be published. Yes. I have seen it.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:That means that we can make reference to thegopīs.
Answer Text: Oh, it is done.Gopīsare boycotted.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:No,gopīsare not boycotted.
Answer Text: The policy should be that the people may not understandgopīslike ordinary girls or like that. You should be careful to present thegopīs.It does not mean that "We shall not utter even the name ofgopīs.We have taken vow to boycott thegopīs."No. They are our worshipable devotees. How we can avoid them?

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:What about writing down "kissing the lips of Kṛṣṇa"?
Answer Text: No. That we should avoid. That we should avoid. But that is not abominable. According to time and circumstances... That thing I have described. The fact is fact. Just like when I am describing Kṛṣṇa'slīlā—I writing Kṛṣṇa's life—so I cannot give up that portion of His life, whenKṛṣṇais actually kissing thegopīsinrasadance.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:But that's in the books. Not in the public...
Answer Text: Yes. So in such circumstances, of course, we can give. But as far as possible, very cautiously and very rarely we shall present.CaitanyaMahāprabhu's life we see that in public He never discussed about Kṛṣṇa'slīlāwith thegopīs.That was very confidential discussion amongst His own circle,RāyaRāmaṇanda,SvarūpaDāmodara, like that. And He inquired... Even a learned scholar, He discussed about the philosophy, thatSarvabhaumaBhaṭṭācārya. But when there was a great devotee likeRāmānandaRāya, He relishedgopīs',I mean to say, intimate behavior withKṛṣṇa. So we should remember this, that public may misunderstand this. Therefore we have to present these things very cautiously, not very openly. They may misunderstand. But so far this article is concerned, that is nicely written. That is quite in order. So this should be published.

Question Text: There is nothing specificially objectionable?
Answer Text: No, no. There is nothing.

Question Text: Our process thus far has been to halve up the material about 50-50. He takes half, and I'll take a half, and that seems to be working fairly nicely.
Answer Text: That's all right. But first thing is that when you are in the post of editors, you are supposed to know. But whenever there is some difficulty, either you get it solved by consulting amongst yourselves, or if it is not possible, then refer to me. That's all.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Oh. Then I have one question to ask you. What about quoting evenVaiṣṇavaliterature that you haven't translated, like theCaitanya-caritāmṛtaor cantos that you haven't translated? That doesn't seem right.
Answer Text: Huh?

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Other translations than your own. What if we want to quote them in some article?
Answer Text: Other translations means?

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Well, sometimes I seeCaitanya-caritāmṛta.Śilavatī even wrote a book about Deity worship, and there's a long quote fromCaitanya-caritāmṛta.I don't know if that's bona fide. I know that the literature is bona fide, but I don't know of any translation that's bona...
Answer Text: Caitanya-caritāmṛta?He has written a book? I have not seen it.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:No. I just mean that devotees, sometimes they write an article and they say, "As it says in theCaitanya-caritāmṛta,"and they quote a book that they read by some scholar, very goodVaiṣṇavaliterature, but translated by somebody that may not be good.
Answer Text: No. Somebody... So farCaitanya-caritāmṛta,thatNavina-candraRāya... You, mean to say that...

Question Text: That six volume set? That is all right?
Answer Text: That is all right. That is translation. That is all right.

Question Text: That is the one which is in use, I believe. It's not anything, you know...
Answer Text: That is simply translation. ButCaitanya-caritāmṛtais now presented in ourTLC.Actually that is our conclusion. AndNavinaRāya's translation, there are sometimes little defects, but not very dangerous, not very dangerous.

Question Text: Should your... In the content, should we put in... How many articles can we put in by you? These are the most important contributions we have, and, say, would it be too much material to put in, say, an essay by you and maybe a lecture or...
Answer Text: Or whatever it may be. That any article may not be more than two, three pages, printed. That will be nice. And if the number of articles are more, how many pages we are going to print?

Question Text: Well, there's some discuss... If we print it on our own press we can print it, we could add eight more pages, which would make it forty pages. But we may continue with Dai Nippon inJapan. So I don't know if we'll increase the pages.
Answer Text: So by increasing the pages, what do we immediately get profit? Is there any special advantage we get?

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:More reading material. More reading material. The customer gets more for his money.
Answer Text: That's all right. We should be businessmen. They should get less for their money. (laughter) We are to pleaseKṛṣṇa, not our customers. So if we are not increasing the price, then why should we increase the pages? Either we print in our own press orJapan, there is extra labor, extra energy. But we are not getting extra money. So there is no need.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:But, Prabhupāda, the point was, can there be more than one article by yourself? Or only one...
Answer Text: No. No. One. One. Everyone one, not more. One man's article, not more than two, either of mine or anyone. But so far our news is concerned...

Question Text: Not more than two or not more than one?
Answer Text: No. Not more than one. Not more than one.

Question Text: You said two or three pages. Maybe four pages would be all...?
Answer Text: Four pages, that's all. But not more than four pages.

Question Text: There was an excerpt from, I think,KṛṣṇaBook...
Answer Text: No. Whatever is done is done. Now you follow this policy, that one...

Question Text: What about excerpts from your books? Is that all right?
Answer Text: Oh, excerpt from my book or my article, the same thing. The same thing. So there is no difference. That is also my writing. And whatever you are writing, that is also my writing. So everything is all right. (laughter)

Question Text: It's all your vibration.
Answer Text: Yes. But they should be divided into different names. (laughter) Just like...

Question Text: I have though of doing Bhaktisiddhānta Sarasvatī'sBrahma-saṁhitā.Do you think we could serialize it maybe in three or fourBack to Godheads?Or could we print it ourselves in a little pamphlet? Or which do you think would be better?
Answer Text: No, if you publish inBack to Godhead,then by portion, similarly, three, four pages. That's all, continually, Bhaktisiddhānta's... So when there will be articles sorted, firstGuruMahārāja's, Bhaktisiddhānta's, then mine. Like that. Yes.

Question Text: Yes. Do you think it would be a good...
Answer Text: If you write something, quotation, from Bhaktivinoda Ṭhākura, that should be first. Just likeguru-paramparā,when we offer our respect, first our own spiritual master, then his spiritual master, then his spiritual master. In this way. But when putting article, that should be the opposite. First Bhaktivinoda, then Bhaktisiddhānta, then my, then my disciples, like that.

Question Text: Kīrtanānanda:Why don't you write some purports to that?
Answer Text: Huh?

Question Text: Kīrtanānanda:To Bhaktisiddhānta'sBrahma-saṁhitā.It would be nice if you would write some purports to it.
Answer Text: Purports?

Question Text: Kīrtanānanda:Yes. Some of us have difficulty understanding BhaktisiddhāntaSarasvatī.
Answer Text: Yes. So if I get time... My time is very limited. So even there is difficulty, let them read over and over and again. Then they will understand. Why should we change it? Let it be presented as BhaktisiddhāntaSarasvatīhas given, and... Then don't give more than one or two pages at a time. Their brain will be puzzled. (laughter) Yes. WhenGuruMahārājawas speaking, at least my brain was puzzled. (laughter) Even he would speak in Bengali, it was very difficult to understand. He was speaking from a very, very high platform. But I wanted to hear him. That's all. Even I did not understand it. That he appreciated, (laughs) that "This boy does not go away. He hears." Actually that was my position. In the beginning I could not understand what he was speaking, but I wanted to hear him. That's all. I was very much anxious to hear him. That he marked. And he was kindly pleased on me, that "He wants to hear. He does not go away." That was my policy, that "let me hear. Even I do not understand, let me hear." That's all. Yes. Actually I did not understand in the beginning what he was speaking. So Bhaktisiddhānta's writing is not very easy to understand. Yes. But we should try, read and read again, and simply that vibration will help us. That's all. It is transcendental vibration, not that everyone will understand. But if you simply give aural reception to the vibration, that will make him advanced, not exactly that anyone has to understand it. Yes. Just like a man is sleeping and somebody is calling him. In his sleeping condition he does not understand. By calling, calling, calling, he gets up because that vibration is there. Not that in his sleeping condition he is understanding what is this sound is coming. So similarly, we should give reception to the transcendental vibrations made byKṛṣṇaand His bona fide representatives. That will make us awakened. Not that we understand everything.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Prabhupāda, in editing, there are two different policies about using capitals. One is to use as few capitals as possible or to use many capitals, in grammar capitalized, or to use few. So sometimes yourNectar of Devotionhas got very few capitals. WhenBalarāmais referred to as "he," there is no capital. But the other policy is to always put... Kṛṣṇa's Hands, capital H, Kṛṣṇa's Feet, capital F,KṛṣṇaWho, capital W. Which is...
Answer Text: No, no, no. Don't follow that policy. That will not be very... Then...

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:The less capitals, the better?
Answer Text: Yes. I think. What do you think?

Question Text: Well, I think, when referring toKṛṣṇa, we should always have a capital "H."
Answer Text: Especially. Yes. Especially forKṛṣṇa, you can.

Question Text: And if we want to, forRādhā, capital "S."
Answer Text: ButBalarāmais not different fromKṛṣṇa.

Question Text: So He is capital "H." But then here we go. (laughter)
Answer Text: No, no. You limit to these three. That will do.

Question Text: Limit to those three.
Answer Text: OrViṣṇu. Yes.Viṣṇu.

Question Text: What aboutavatāras,in reference to Christ orBuddha?
Answer Text: Buddhais capital used. Jesus Christ is capital used.

Question Text: No, "He."
Answer Text: No. That you can use...

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Small.
Answer Text: Yes.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Then words like Kṛṣṇa's "pastimes," "entourage," His "will."
Answer Text: No, small.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Small.
Answer Text: Yes.

Question Text: The possessions ofKṛṣṇa, small.
Answer Text: Small.

Question Text: Lotus feet?
Answer Text: Yes.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Lotus flower?
Answer Text: Yes. All small. Simply name. Stick to name.

Question Text: The pronoun,Kṛṣṇa, "who." The pronoun "who," that's not...
Answer Text: No, no. Use small.

Question Text: Thank you. There's so many... That causes a headache for everyone.
Answer Text: No. It is better to make everything sound but slow. We want to create this position ofBack to Godheadas very authorized representation of the science of God. In future people may refer to it, so we should very cautiously and very nicely do it. It is very important thing,Back to Godhead.If our movement is going to be recognized as scientific, God consciousness movement, then thisBack to Godheadwill be referred as authorized scripture. So therefore we have to prepare in such a way, nothing non-conclusive can be introduced in this. That should be our policy. And actually it is the position ofBack to Godhead.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Oh. Well, this is...
Answer Text: Glossary?

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:For theĪśopaniṣad.AndHayagrīvaPrabhuthought that there was too much preaching in the definition. Like, say, in the definition ofbhakti,I shouldn't say,"Bhaktiis the highest form ofyoga." Well, I don't know if... I'm not speaking your words, but to make it, not to preach more, but I thought that was right.
Answer Text: Glossary should be short as possible.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Short as possible.
Answer Text: Yes. At the same time carrying the meaning.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:The conclusion ofVaiṣṇavaphilosophy. That's the absolute meaning.
Answer Text: Yes. It should not be describing the definition. That is not glossary. Glossary should be explained in gist, but the meaning should be carried.

Question Text: Well, can we use, for instance, the glossary to yourŚrīmad-Bhāgavatamprinted in India, can we use that as a model for...? Is that...?
Answer Text: Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam?

Question Text: You have a glossary at the end of the first volume. Is that the type of glossary...?
Answer Text: Yes. I have given glossary. You can follow that principle. Yes. And at the end of each book, glossary, index, will carry weight.

Question Text: Well, that was fairly terse if I remember, though. That was fairly terse. I mean very short, brief. Definitions were very...
Answer Text: One thing may appear to be very simple and to other, terse, but you do your own duty. Another thing: where is theBhagavad-gītāwith my full translation and synonyms? Where is that manuscript?

Question Text: I have... There are several existing manuscripts. I have... The manuscript I went over is in Columbus.
Answer Text: Whole?

Question Text: The total manuscript is there.
Answer Text: So we have to prepare for next publication, revised and enlarged, giving in the same process: original verse, transliteration, synonyms, and translation, and purport.

Question Text: I've already started that, the first chapter.
Answer Text: Our first printing will be this, what is name?Nectar of Devotion.And then, if possible,Bhagavad-gītāAs It Is,revised and enlarged.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Īśopaniṣadis even beforeNectar of Devotion.
Answer Text: Yes.Īśopaniṣad.That is already... And thenBhāgavatam.ThenBhāgavatam.And so farKṛṣṇais concerned,Kṛṣṇawe shall print after thisNectar of Devotionin our press if it is printed. But if I get some money, contribution, from George Harrison, then I may get it printed immediately fromJapan. Yes.

Question Text: Jayadvaita:There's another manuscript ofBhagavad-gītāalso in New York, the original.
Answer Text: Oh. You have got?

Question Text: Jayadvaita:Yes. It's in New York except for the first two chapters. Everything else is there.
Answer Text: So first two chapters might be withJanārdana. But you have got the whole thing,Hayagrīva.

Question Text: Jayadvaita:Some of it has been edited by Rāyarāma, but you can see around it and go to the original behind it.
Answer Text: So whatever is lacking, you ask me. I will supply you.

Question Text: I would like to see that in going over mine. I'll have to go over it chapter by chapter. But I will compare the version I have with that version, and... I know the translations themselves, they were somewhat changed inBhagavad-gītāAs It Isas it came out in Macmillan. Did you like those translations?
Answer Text: Whichever is better, you think. That's all. You can follow this Macmillan.

Question Text: That was the second... They're good. I think they're very good.
Answer Text: Yes. You can follow that translation. Simply synonyms he can add, transliterations.

Question Text: And we have all the purports. We can include everything. Nothing will be deleted. Everything will be in there.
Answer Text: That's all right.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Prabhupāda, I have a question and it applies only to me, but it's important. A year ago you wrote me in a letter when I was..., said the editing was going slow, to pay more attention to managing the temple. So...
Answer Text: Yes. Managing, you, why don't you make this Giriraja as the temple manager?

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:But still... I've already done that. I've made him, but practically I'm still managing anyway. And I madeMurārimanager, but still I'm... I don't spend much time in editing. People are always coming, and I'm running all over the place. I don't edit at all. It makes mesad. I don't...
Answer Text: No, no. They must give relief to you. You can give them instruction, but the actual execution should be done...Pradyumnais there. He can also do. But anyone who is expert in management, he should be... Temple management should not be done directly by you. You can give him policy that "You do like this." That's all. Because you have got so many other things to do. Yes. So you create. If there is no expert manager, you create some manager. That is most important thing, to create. To become... (laughs) In our college there was one Mr. Kidd, professor of economics. He was always chastising us. We were student; he was our professor. "Oh, you cannot have independence. You cannot manage it. You cannot manage. You can work just like ass, but if some asses are given under you, you cannot work." He was talking like that. "So don't cry for independence. You are not yet nation." He was talking like that. So actually his experience was nice, that since the Britishers have gone away, the management of Indian government is not nice. They cannot manage. So he was experienced. He told. I sometimes remember that Professor Kidd told me like that. (laughs) So we have to create nice administrator. That is another function, you see? Every department, we shall create assistant, assistant. So that in case he is ill or he is sick, he cannot work, somebody must work for him.

Question Text: That is how we can expand also.
Answer Text: Yes. Some assistant always must be there, training of assistant. So far your editorial is concerned, you can train. NowPuruṣottama, he can also assist you. Similarly, Gaurasundara can assist you.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Jayadvaita is already...
Answer Text: Ah, Jayadvaita. So in this way you should create assistant editors also.

Question Text: Thus far Satsvarūpa...
Answer Text: That dictaphone can be done in Detroit. That boyBhagavāndāsais here. He has offered service.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:There's one thing... It seems to be easy, but it's very difficult to hear your voice.
Answer Text: That will require practice. He may commit some mistake in the beginning, but when he is practiced, he will do the right thing. So that you cannot avoid. You cannot change my voice.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:So just now you've sent aKṛṣṇatape. Should I, rather than do that, give it toBhagavān?
Answer Text: No. First of all test him, who will do that. Test him here, whether he can understand. (break?)

Question Text: I also have a dictaphone in New York, Prabhupāda.
Answer Text: That is mine.

Question Text: No. I have another one also. I also can have tapes typed.
Answer Text: So that can be distributed, tapes. Yes. In different centers they will have dictaphone and they'll do it.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:And then send me the copy to edit.
Answer Text: Yes. Yes.

Question Text: But before you send them, make a tape, make a recording of them so you can check them over if you want to check them over. 'Cause I don't have time to do that.
Answer Text: Yes. So taping, recording, that does not take much time.

Question Text: No. Somebody can do that for you.
Answer Text: You can keep it and record. Yes. So manage in that way. We have to train so many things. So tactfully you have to do that.

Question Text: Then he does the first editing. After it's typed up off the dictaphone, Satsvarūpa does the first editing. Then I go over what he has gone over and check the manuscript...
Answer Text: Yes. What you do, he goes. And what he does, you go. Then final. In this way. But the last editing should be checked twice. The dictaphone, then checked by him and then by you. Or checked by you and then by him. That's all.

Question Text: Yes. AndPradyumnadoes the Sanskrit after.
Answer Text: Yes. That's all. That is printing department.

Question Text: And then Jayadvaita does the composing.
Answer Text: Jayadvaita and others.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:PālikāandArundhati.
Answer Text: Now, I heard that you are composing fifty pages daily, altogether?

Question Text: Jayadvaita:No, not fifty pages. The manuscript pages, yesterday we composed about forty manuscript pages.
Answer Text: Correct, all? Complete?

Question Text: Jayadvaita:Yes. The original... It's done twice. So those first pages, the first time, they'd already been done.
Answer Text: No, no. These forty pages, they are complete?

Question Text: Jayadvaita:Yes. They are complete.
Answer Text: That's nice. That is encouraging. So even if you complete thirty pages daily, that will be very nice.

Question Text: They'll get faster because ŚyāmadāsīandArundhatiwere just typing fourteen hours a day in Columbus and they were getting at least twenty manuscript pages done, and now it's...
Answer Text: Anyway, you are the in-charge of this composition. You orJaya-govinda? Who is in charge of the composition?

Question Text: Jayadvaita:Mostly I am doing it.
Answer Text: Accha.Then you get easily not less than thirty pages daily, complete. That will satisfy. Is that all right?

Question Text: Jayadvaita:That's all right.
Answer Text: Yes. Then our books are, biggest book, four hundred pages. So thirty pages daily means, what is that? Within fifteen days you can complete.

Question Text: Jayadvaita:Thirty manuscript pages, thirty book pages?
Answer Text: Thirty book pages. No. Or what is the manuscript pages? I do not understand.

Question Text: Jayadvaita:When it's typed out, we've been doing about...
Answer Text: I want complete for being photographed.

Question Text: Forty of these.
Answer Text: Oh. All right. These are forty pages. Such, say, in fifteen days how many pages?

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:450.
Answer Text: So you take up twenty days, one month for one book?

Question Text: I cannot edit much faster than forty pages a day.
Answer Text: No, no. Don't do it, I mean to say, so hastily. But do it slowly and surely. That will be nice. Yes.

Question Text: One book, one month.
Answer Text: No, that you are printing, that "one book, one month" for the last six months. (laughs) That is in theory only. Actually it has not happened. Now do everything solidly so that at least in two months we finish one book. That's all. Is that all right?

Question Text: Jayadvaita:Yes.
Answer Text: You say everything all right. (laughter) Anyway...

Question Text: I didn't edit so many today. I edited fifty yesterday.
Answer Text: So I think I want... I shall be very glad to see theNectar of Devotionis finished before I leave this place and you begin some other book.

Question Text: Jayadvaita:The second part... We've finished the first part. We're now into the second part.
Answer Text: Second part, which second part?

Question Text: You want me to doNectar of Devotionand thenKṛṣṇaand thenBhagavad-gītā,in that order?
Answer Text: Yes. So everything is all right,bṛhat-mṛdaṅgadepartment? Majorsaṅkīrtanaparty. They are going,saṅkīrtanaparties in different cities. That is junior. But your, this party, it is senior. You are sitting one place; you have to work thousand times more than them. Yes. You have to edit in such a way. Where is that water?

Question Text: It's being offered, Prabhupāda.
Answer Text: All right, all right. That's all...

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:I have a question from the art department.
Answer Text: Art, yes.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Jadurānī asks are they going too slow? She wants to know are they going too slow. They have thirty pictures ready.
Answer Text: One thing, that Jadurānī should have some assistants. She alone cannot do that.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Well, Prabhupāda, you used that word once before, assistant. So then when Jāhnavā saw that letter she said, "That means I should paint." So all that assistant meant was that they all painted. And Śāradīyā began to paint. I don't know what you mean by assistant.
Answer Text: Assistant means that they should work under her direction. That is assistant.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:And produce pictures side by side with her.
Answer Text: Yes. I give some idea, sketch, and then under that sketch, instruction of Jadurānī, and...

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:So according to Jadurānī, only she, Muralīdhara,Devahūti, and Baradraj were good enough, that the other weren't good painters, Jāhnavā and Śāradīyā. But I don't know that.
Answer Text: Then they may practice. They may be given to practice, not the actual work. So... But they are scattered in different places.

Question Text: Baradraj is coming to Boston.
Answer Text: Baradraj is good. Yes. He can... If he likes, he can do much work.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:And Muralīdhara is good and also produces.Devahūtiis good, but doesn't produce.
Answer Text: SoDevahūtihas gone. I would have talked with her.

Question Text: Yes. I don't have her address.
Answer Text: Oh, she does not live in the temple.

Question Text: Kīrtanānanda:What aboutMādhava-lati?
Answer Text: Yes. She is good painter.

Question Text: Kīrtanānanda:She's exhibiting a much niceratti... She had asarion today, Prabhupāda.
Answer Text: Huh?

Question Text: Kīrtanānanda:She had asarion today.
Answer Text: Sari?

Question Text: Kīrtanānanda:Yes. She was wearing asariat the temple. She looks very nice.
Answer Text: No, she is nice. She is talented.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:She could be an assistant painter.
Answer Text: And why not somebody marry her? If somebody want to marry, then she will be all right.

Question Text: Nayanābhirāma wanted to marry her.
Answer Text: Then why not ask and get her married? Yes. Then she will be fixed up. I think she requires to be married. Then she will be satisfied.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:One more question from art was...
Answer Text: She is here. I recommend that just ask her to get married. If she agrees, that, what is that boy?

Question Text: Nayanābhirāma.
Answer Text: Let them marry and live here.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:The other question was, is the subject matter, as they're being done, is there any criticism or should it be changed? The paintings that have been finished thus far, should they be changed in some way?
Answer Text: Then... These paintings are first-class, these paintings.

Question Text: Is that one first-class there, Prabhupāda?
Answer Text: No.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:What's the trouble?
Answer Text: The trouble is that Kṛṣṇa's body is... Why it is made so big? Why the others, inhabitants ofVṛndāvana, smaller?

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:He's supposed to be up in the front. He's supposed to be in the front, and they're all behind Him. But it mustn't be done well enough.
Answer Text: Well, that is... Do you think that is represented?Kṛṣṇadid not show His gigantic body. As He was, He lifted. Yes.

Question Text: He seems gigantic.
Answer Text: Kṛṣṇacould show His gigantic. Actually He expanded His gigantic body. Otherwise how He could lift?

Question Text: Kīrtanānanda:These are very nice.
Answer Text: These things are... Yes.

Question Text: Do you like this one, Prabhupāda?
Answer Text: This is also not bad, but...

Question Text: Kīrtanānanda:The calf looks like a dog.
Answer Text: Huh? Yes.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:So they should be done over.
Answer Text: Yes. Yes. This is all right. You see? So you can take some photograph like this picture. This is also...Kṛṣṇais patting a cow.

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:That's a good one.
Answer Text: Yes.

Question Text: We should just reproduce that as it is?
Answer Text: Yes, why not?

Question Text: Gurudāsa has some very excellent pictures from the archives taken from books that were printed several hundreds of years ago,Bhagavad-gītāand some woodcuts ofNṛsiṁha, which would be considered quite artistic, but maybe we can send them to you to see if they meet your approval and maybe reproduce them.
Answer Text: No, whatever card, form, we get, unless we have got arrangement for worship... Of course, we can keep, but our, any form, wooden or stone, that should be worshiped.

Question Text: These are photographs, these are pictures.
Answer Text: Oh, pictures. Then it is all right. All right. It is all right?

Question Text: Satsvarūpa:Yes. That's all.
Answer Text: That's all. So now distributeprasādam.First of all, chant once moreHareKṛṣṇa. (end)
